articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

images.name: Chris Henry Jr. [608x342]
images.caption: Chris Henry Jr. committed to Ohio State in July of 2023.

images.name: Keenyi Pepe [800x800]
images.caption: Keenyi Pepe adds another impressive building block to USC's OL class.

articles.byline: Craig Haubert, Eli Lederman and Tom Luginbill

articles.headline: Jaden O'Neal gives Florida State highest-rated QB since 2022 class
articles.description: Four-star quarterback Jaden O'Neal, ranked No. 112 in the 2026 ESPN 300, announced his commitment to Florida State on Sunday night, sealing a long-anticipated flip for the former Oklahoma pledge.

articles.headline: Defensive end Richard Wesley commits to Texas Longhorns
articles.description: Defensive end Richard Wesley, a 6-foot-5, 250-pound pass rusher from Chatsworth, California, has committed to Texas, the No. 18 overall prospect in the 2026 ESPN 300 announced on Sunday night following an official visit with the Longhorns this weekend.

articles.headline: Ex-Buckeye Kirk Barton facing charge after fatal crash in Ohio
articles.description: Kirk Barton, a former captain at Ohio State who went on to play in the NFL, faces an aggravated vehicular manslaughter charge following a fatal crash early Saturday morning.

articles.headline: Notre Dame lands commitments from Khary Adams, Joey O'Brien
articles.description: Notre Dame landed pledges from a pair of top 2026 defensive back targets Friday, edging a trio of recruiting rivals to the commitments of No. 8 cornerback Khary Adams and No. 4 athlete prospect Joey O'Brien.

articles.headline: Oklahoma fills need with commitment of 4-star QB Bowe Bentley
articles.description: Four-star quarterback Bowe Bentley, No. 261 in the 2026 ESPN 300, announced his commitment to Oklahoma over LSU on Friday.

article.headline: Appalachian State cruises over The Citadel 49-0
article.description: — Chase Brice threw for four touchdowns, ran for another and Appalachian State rolled to a 49-0 win on Saturday over The Citadel.
article.linkText: Appalachian State cruises over The Citadel 49-0

images.name: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn
images.caption: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn

video.headline: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn
video.caption: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn
video.title: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn
video.description: Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Chase Brice throws 80-yard TD pass to Christian Horn) 2022/10/01 ESHEET

article.story: BOONE, N.C. -- — Chase Brice threw for four touchdowns, ran for another and Appalachian State rolled to a 49-0 win on Saturday over The Citadel. The Mountaineers' (3-2) first four games were decided by four points or fewer but that wasn't the case against the Bulldogs (2-2), who they outgained 545-223. It was the 43rd meeting between the teams but the first nonconference game between them since the Mountaineers left for the FBS. The Mountaineers scored touchdowns on five of their first six possessions in taking off to a 35-0 lead. Brice was 12-of-18 passing for 265 yards with two of his scoring throws going to Christian Horn, one an 80-yarder. Horn's older brother, Brian Horn, plays linebacker for The Citadel. Christian Horn finished with 132 yards receiving and two touchdowns. Camerun Peoples rushed for 102 yards, 73 coming on a second-quarter TD. Bulldogs grad transfer quarterback Peyton Derrick started his collegiate career at Appalachian State, where he spent two years before playing three seasons at Wofford. The triple-option oriented Bulldogs couldn't generate much offense, picking up 172 yards on 59 attempts for a 2.9 average. The shutout was the first for the Mountaineers since a 34-0 victory over Toledo in 2017. ------
